articles.author: Caroline Linton
articles.title: Trump: "mostly my family has been suffering" over impeachment
articles.description: Fox News' Sean Hannity had a friendly, eight-minute pre-Super Bowl interview with the president.
articles.content: In a pre-Super Bowl interview on Sunday, President Trump told Fox News' Sean Hannity that "mostly my family has been suffering" from the impeachment process. In a friendly, eight-minute interview, Mr. Trump also touched on the Democratic candidates for presid… [+1649 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 8th U.S. case of coronavirus confirmed in Massachusetts; U.S. declares a public health emergency and will bar some foreign nationals from entering the country
articles.description: U.S. officials have declared a public health emergency.
articles.content: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper on Saturday approved a request from the Department of Health and Human Services for housing support for "1,000 people who may need to be quarantined" due to the coronavirus, according to a Defense Department press release. The … [+1300 chars]

articles.author: Kathryn Watson
articles.title: National security adviser "very confident" NSC didn't leak Bolton manuscript
articles.description: "I am very confident that the leaks of that book did not come from the NSC," the national security adviser told CBS News' "Face the Nation."
articles.content: Washington — National security adviser Robert O'Brien told "Face the Nation" he is "very confident" no one within the National Security Council leaked the contents of a manuscript by his predecessor, John Bolton. Bolton's forthcoming book, according to report… [+2105 chars]

articles.title: Transcript: Robert O'Brien on "Face the Nation"
articles.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Robert O'Brien that aired Sunday, February 2, 2020, on "Face the Nation."
articles.content:
The following is a transcript of an interview with Robert O'Brien that aired Sunday, February 2, 2020, on "Face the Nation."
MARGARET BRENNAN: We begin this morning with President Trump's national security adviser, Robert O'Brien. Good morning to you, Mr. Am… [+10043 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: New York City officials provide update on possible coronavirus case
articles.description: A patient is being evaluated for coronavirus at Bellevue Hospital in New York City. Mayor Bill de Blasio and Public Health Commissioner Oxiris Barbot updated reporters Saturday with the latest on the possible case and how the city is responding.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 2/1: CBS Evening News
articles.description: Coronavirus case is confirmed in Massachusetts as U.S. health officials declare public health emergency; Mary Higgins Clark, “Queen of Suspense” dies at 92.
